result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Jonathan Marc Houareau appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CM235, 16CM400, 16CM407 & 16CM474.  There is an agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 5 in 16CM474.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 5 in 16CM474. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 in 16CM474 and 16CM400, 16CM407, and reads in and dismisses 15CM235.   Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 16CM474
- Court corders court costs of $443.00 and $200 for the DNA surcharge.  
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- DE to report to the jail to give a DNA sample
- 20 dasy to appeal

*AMENDED*

INCLUDES CASE 16CM400, 16CM407, 16CM474 & 15CM235
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jonathan Marc Houareau appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 16CM407, 16CM474, 15CM309, 15CT83 & 15TR866.     Court proceeds with the plea/sentencing on 15CT83.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CT83.  Crt reviews the police reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CT83. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3 in 15CT83 & dismisses 15CM309 & 15TR866. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

Ct. 1 in 15CT83
- W/S 18 months probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 45 days in the St. Croix County Jail with 14 days stayed and credit for 31 served.
- DE to begin serving his sentence by 7:00 p.m. on 09/14/16
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 24 month driver's license revocation
- 24 month IID
- Huber is granted on the remaining 14 days
- DE to have NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brittany Schnee.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Court costs of $1,694.00 apply money from all files (bonds are being modified to signature)
- Restitution to the New Richmond Police Department in the amount of $85.00 for the blood draw apply money from all files
- DE to remain in custody until signing up for probation and the court is ordering probation to meet with the DE on 08/10/2016
- 20 days to appeal

Court modifies the bonds in 16CM400, 16CM407, 16CM474 & 15CM235 to signature bonds and any bonds on file to be paid towards the court costs and restitution in 15CT83
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF ATTY: John Kucinski, DF: Jonathan Marc Houareau appeared from jail. Attorney Kucinski withdraws his motion.  Set out for PTC on both files.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:02 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

-Defendant to retrieve his belongings with an Officer.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   Brittany S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
